content.description: Climb cracks/flakes up and right for about 25' to a good rest. Begin traversing up and left on good feet and bad hands before heading straight up to the anchor.
content.protection: 5 bolts. The guide lists this as a mixed route, but it is definitely doable with nothing more than quick draws.
content.location: Starts in a shallow dihedral/scoop just right of the middle of the wall.

content.description: Start by traversing left past the first few bolts (crux) then charge up the steep slab on crimps and drip pockets. Fun movement on small holds up a slab, this climb is a quality example of the climbing provided by the gray Madison limestone found in this and other areas across Montana.
content.location: On the left hand side of the Vision Quest Wall are two bolted slabs. This is the right route of the two.

content.description:
One of the longest routes in the area, this will use all but a couple meters of your 60m rope and will utilize every technique you've got: stemming, crackwork, slab, bouldery pulls, you name it! Start with a short boulder problem to make the first clip and gain a big ledge. Get your slab game on here and start a left-ward trending traverse up across a blank looking (from below) face aiming for a small roof. Cross overtop this with a committing move (good exposure!) and into a groove with a tree. From here continue for another few clips up a cool shallow dihedral using edges and good fingerlocks in the crystal-lined crack.

Gets .10d/.11a in the guidebook but really no defined crux on this one, just some good exposure and a couple short tricky sequences up high.
content.protection: Lots of bolts (14?) to chain anchors just below the crag summit
content.location: On the vision quest wall, locate the obvious dihedral with a crack on the left side. This is bolt line to the right, arching leftward across the blank looking face. The climb to the right, which transfers across an awesome looking little alcove/undercling, is Peyote (.11b/c)

content.description: Start on a blunt arete that leads to the crux then climb to a ledge to rest before pulling back onto the wall for the last third of the climb.
content.location: Located just right of Peyote on the Vision Quest Wall.

content.description:
Start by climbing up a small mound of dirt and gravel straight into the crux. Slippery side pulls and open handed holds in the steep quickly give way to easier slab and the anchor. If the crux section was longer, this would be a mega classic.

The Brunckhorst guide calls this 5.12a, but it seems more like V3 or V4, so more in the mid-11 range.
content.location: Left side of the small detached wall / boulder to the extreme left side of the Vision Quest Wall.

content.description: Hard edges lead to a bulge. Pull this, then tend right onto slab. The climbing eases the higher you go.
content.protection: Bolts to chains. Pro includes a slung hueco just after the first bolt.
content.location: Route starts about 50 feet up the slippery talus in the gully to the left of the Bear Claw Buttress (the far right end of the Vision Quest Wall). Look for a slung pass through about 15 feet up the route, just after the first bolt.
